field_edited_text.value:
Other coverage limitations (Areas are shown on Exhibit en-
titled, Site Definition, opposite page):



Area "A"
Area '""B"
Area HC!I
Area "'D"
Area IIEII
Area HFH
Area IIGII

The Developer may utilize AIR RIGHTS above the
Baltimore Street sidewalk from El. 57'to El. 75';
however, only that portion of the available air
rights actually utilized by proposed building con-

struction will be conveyed by deed tothe developer. :

»
Within this area, a TOWER may be built with cov-
erage not to exceed 30% of the entire property (i.e.
17,846 square feet) and not to exceed El. 350" in
height; the remainder of this area, outside of ac-

tual tower coverage, shall not exceed El. 75' in

height.

Perpetual easement to be retained at and above
ground level by the City for public pedestrian use.
Private vehicular access (ramp and tunnel) must
be provided as shown on the ''Site Definition'' draw-
ingand will be permitted within the easement area.
No structures will be permitted at or above side-
walk grades except for necessary ramp walls and
railings, the Hopkins Place overpass and its nec-
essary supports (see "REQUIREMENTS" below)
and landscape design elements.

The City will retain a perpetual easement over this
area for public pedestrian access at and above
El. 44' on the east and at and above sidewalk grade
on the west; no structures will be permitted above
these elevations except for required second-level
walkway at El. 59'f, and any necessary supports
and roof, railings and stairs, and landscape design
elements.

This area is a setback from Hopkins Place; no
structures are permitted above adjacent sidewalk
and Park (Area 14A) grades except for upper-level
walkway at El. 59'f, and any necessary supports
and roof, railings andstairs, and landscape design
elements.

No structure, or part thereof, will be permitted
above El. 90'; in any case, no more than two full
floors will be permitted.

The City will lease to the developer, for One Dol-
lar ($1.00) a year until March 25, 1999, the nec-
essary rights to allow him to construct and main-
tain the required egress ramp and tunnel in the
right-of-way of Hopkins Place.

11

£
